body.p: When the adaptive immune system is functioning many cells are kicked into high gear. Which cell type is paired with its correct function?

multiple_choice.choice: B cells manufacture antibodies, which are proteins that circulate and bind to foreign antigens
T helper cells are needed to act as sentries for mucus membranes
Cytotoxic T cells circulate and remove immune cells that are no longer functioning properly
Memory T Cells will produce antibodies the next time the foreign pathogen tries to get into the cell

feedback.p: Correct. B cells make antibodies that respond to a molecule, usually a protein found on the surface of a foreign invader.
Incorrect. T helper cells interact with other cells of the immune system to stimulate an adaptive immune response. They circulate freely within the entire body.
Incorrect. Cytotoxic T cells are capable of directly attacking foreign invaders; they do not do “garbage removal.”
Incorrect. Memory B cells respond by clonal expansion followed by antibody production. T cells do not make antibodies.
